text: Seymour Jones (October 19, 1862 – March 13, 1951) was an American politician who served in the Oregon House of Representatives. A state representative from Marion County from 1916 to 1921, he was chosen to serve as Speaker of that body from 1919 to 1921. Jones also served as Oregon's state marketing agent from 1927 to 1931. ==References== Category:Speakers of the Oregon House of Representatives Category:1962 deaths Category:1862 births Category:Politicians from Salem, Oregon Category:Oregon lawyers Category:Oregon Republicans Category:Ranchers from Oregon Category:Lawyers from Salem, Oregon
title: Seymour Jones
